intro: Gnaphalium heleios, commonly known as the sunflower weed, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and is typically found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The plant has feathery, aromatic leaves that release a mild scent when crushed. It thrives in full sun and is often seen in temperate regions of Europe and North America. Gnaphalium heleios is a hardy perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
